Text:
Now then...Natsu, Kana, do you remember what day it
is today?

It is the day we submit the samples we created after
stealing—I mean, referring to—the Mitsugoshi kimono.
Exactly. Show me our Snow Fox Corporation's sample.
Yes, here it is!
Aha... May I examine it?

Yes, please do! We've replicated the texture down to
the smallest detail!
Let's see...
*gulp*
Hmm...
*gulp*

The texture feels slightly rougher than the texture
of the Mitsugoshi product.
And the pattern is also a bit inferior.
R-Right, I see...

We're no match for Mitsugoshi's craftsmanship or
the originality of their designs.

There isn't much we can do when it comes to
craftsmanship, and even less so when it comes to
design. Our design is like a cross between existing
flowers.

So you caught our cross between roses and
sunflowers!
I told you we shouldn't have gone with that!

Now, now, let's not start throwing around blame.
It's not helping.
It's not like this is a bad pattern.

But ours is a 1+1 equals 2 design. Mitsugoshi's is a
design created from 0.

We can't ignore the originality and trend-setting
nature of Mitsugoshi's kimono.
Ulp... I am truly sorry...

No, this is fine. Let's proceed with this kimono and
mass-produce it.
Really? Are you sure?

I have a plan. We'll set the price slightly lower
than Mitsugoshi's kimono.
Oh, in other words...
You want it to look like a blatant imitation?!
That's right. Trust me, and just do as I say.
R-Right... Understood...
A few days later...

L-Lady Yukime! I can't believe it! Our new kimono
are a hit!

Despite genuine Mitsugoshi products being on the
market, we have a monopoly in the Lawless City!

Hehe. Just as I expected. We're making hand over
fist.
But why...?

I shouldn't say this, but Mitsugoshi's kimono are
way better.

Natsu, Kana. The value of a thing isn't limited to
its quality. This is a good learning experience.
Lady Yukime, what's the trick behind it?

They must know it is obviously a rip-off... Are they
buying it by mistake?

Our customers aren't stupid. They know they're
copies.
What? Then why?

There are several reasons, but the main one is...
price.

Mitsugoshi's kimono are of high quality, so they
come at a higher price.

Oh, you are right, Lady Yukime! We have kept our
prices much lower!

They want to buy Mitsugoshi's kimono but settle for
our imitations because they don't have enough money.

Customers tend to seek satisfaction within the
limits of their budget.

Our town certainly has a limited number of wealthy
residents, making it hard for them to get their hands
on Mitsugoshi's kimono.

In the red-light district, a kimono is everyday wear.
The top priority is to satisfy daily needs in terms
of ease of care.

That's the mindset of customers who buy our copycat
products.

I see... I was wondering why imitations could sell
better than the real deal.

After hearing your explanation, I think I understand
a little better.

You think you understand, huh? That's when it's most
dangerous.
Huh? Really?

When you think you know something, you can easily
trip up... Let your guard down, and before you know
it, you're in deep water.

That's the world of business for you...
It's important to always be learning.
I see!
I'll keep that in mind!

Hehe. As long as you two remain open to listening to
others, you'll be just fine.

(And you're not alone, there are two of you. You can
support each other.)

The two of you combined make up a fully competent
adult.

Wait, are you saying each of us is only half
competent?
Heheh. I guess you could interpret it that way.

But...won't Mitsugoshi have something to say about us
blatantly selling imitations?
